About Me

I am a mental health specialist and behavioral researcher with over four years of experience at McLean-Franciscan’s psychiatric unit, a Harvard-affiliated hospital. My work spans front-line psychiatric care, high-acuity crisis de-escalation, and systems-level behavioral analytics. During the COVID-19 pandemic, I founded Psyber Nexus, an initiative translating psychological insights into operational intelligence for public sector strategy. I hold a Bachelor’s in Psychology from Siena College and have pursued graduate-level coursework at Boston University and Harvard Extension School.

I am seeking opportunities to apply my expertise in investigative, analytic, and mission-critical environments, contributing to the security and integrity of American communities through behavioral science and ethical governance.

Psyber Nexus

Founded during the COVID-19 pandemic, Psyber Nexus bridges psychological insight and operational intelligence to inform public sector strategies.

Academic Background

  • Harvard Extension School – Graduate-level coursework in psychology
  • Boston University – Graduate studies in Applied Clinical Psychology
  • Siena College – Bachelor of Arts, Psychology (2013)

Strategic Goals

I aim to support law enforcement agencies, public health systems, and oversight bodies in making better decisions through the integration of behavioral science, investigative rigor, and ethical governance.
